items.name: All-knowing Helm
items.description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

items.name: Aristocrat Hat
items.description: Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

items.name: Aristocrat Headband
items.description: Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.

items.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Alberich's Pointed Hat.

items.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
items.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

items.name: Bandit Mask
items.description: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

items.name: Black Dumpling
items.description: Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty. It magnifies one's fears and make them acutely aware of all forms of pain Raises attack power when the wearer suffers from madness. When the Black Dumpling goes on, the torturer no longer seeks answers; only to inflict suffering without hope of relief.

items.name: Banished Knight Helm (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Banished Knight Helm

items.name: Ash-of-war Scarab
items.description: Gray scarab worn directly on the head.

items.name: Astrologer Hood
items.description: Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

items.name: Black Hood
items.description: Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.

items.name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
items.description: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

items.name: Banished Knight Helm
items.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

items.name: Beast Champion Helm
items.description: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

items.name: Black Wolf Mask
items.description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

items.name: Bloodsoaked Mask
items.description: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.

items.name: Black Knife Hood
items.description: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be N u men who had close ties with Marika herself.

items.name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
items.description: Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

items.name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
items.description: Metal helm with a pointed beak. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

items.name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
items.description: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners. Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart. To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

items.name: Blue Festive Hood
items.description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

items.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
items.description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with black flames.

items.name: Blue Cloth Cowl
items.description: Cowl of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever-drifting.

items.name: Champion Headband
items.description: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

items.name: Chain Coif
items.description: Coif made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

items.name: Bull-goat Helm
items.description: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

items.name: Brave's Cord Circlet
items.description: Warrior's headband of woven leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat often found hung from these headbands are prayers of farewell from the people of their home. In bidding farewell t warriors departing on a journey from which they aren't like to return, this small act offers only meager relief.

items.name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
items.description: Blue scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors.

items.name: Cleanrot Helm
items.description: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

items.name: Carian Knight Helm
items.description: Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

items.name: Briar Helm
items.description: Battered iron helm from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of he Brair.

items.name: Brave's Leather Helm
items.description: Battlewear wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

items.name: Cleanrot Helm (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Cleanrot Helm

items.name: Confessor Hood
items.description: Black hood for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

items.name: Commoner's Headband (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Headband

items.name: Confessor Hood (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Confessor Hood

items.name: Commoner's Headband
items.description: A headband with the cloth removed. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

items.name: Consort's Mask
items.description: Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.

items.name: Crucible Axe Helm
items.description: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

items.name: Crimson Hood
items.description: A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.  Worn by expatriates royalty.  Increases vigor.

items.name: Crimson Tear Scarab
items.description: Red scarab worn directly on the head. The red scarabs roll clumps of crimson tears during their labors.

items.name: Crucible Tree Helm
items.description: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

items.name: Diallos's Mask
items.description: Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.

items.name: Drake Knight Helm (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Drake Knight Helm.

items.name: Depraved Perfumer Headscarf
items.description: Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers.

items.name: Cuckoo Knight Helm
items.description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

items.name: Duelist Helm
items.description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

items.name: Eccentric's Hood
items.description: A pointy, ragged hood. Worn by the knight Jerren. The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

items.name: Drake Knight Helm
items.description: Black iron helm worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe

items.name: Eccentric's Hood (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Eccentric's Hood

items.name: Elden Lord Crown
items.description: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

items.name: Envoy Crown
items.description: The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys. Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth. Raises the potency of bubble-based skills. No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

items.name: Exile Hood
items.description: Deep red hood that covers the whole head. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

items.name: Festive Hood (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Festive Hood

items.name: Festive Hood
items.description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Decorated with many-colored flowers.

items.name: Finger Maiden Fillet
items.description: Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

items.name: Fire Monk Hood
items.description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks.

items.name: Fire Prelate Helm
items.description: Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

items.name: Fia's Hood
items.description: Hood of black cloth that covers the whole head. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

items.name: Fingerprint Helm
items.description: Iron helm singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

items.name: Foot Soldier Cap
items.description: Flanged iron cap widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

items.name: Foot Soldier Helm
items.description: Wholly unembellished iron helm. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

items.name: Gilded Foot Soldier Cap
items.description: Flanged cap made from gilded iron. Issued to foot soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.

items.name: Gelmir Knight Helm
items.description: Helm worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Its crest of red feathers symbolizes Rykard's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son.

items.name: Glintstone Scarab
items.description: Blue-green scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of sorcery during their labors.

items.name: Godrick Knight Helm
items.description: Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

items.name: Grass Hair Ornament
items.description: A headdress made from wildflowers. Wearing this might make you less easy to spot.

items.name: Godskin Noble Hood
items.description: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unilke the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

items.name: Foot Soldier Helmet
items.description: Helmet with a protective metal plate. Widely issued to foot soldiers in lord's army.

items.name: Godrick Soldier Helm
items.description: Helm worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

items.name: Godskin Apostle Hood
items.description: Hood made by seweing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

items.name: Great Horned Headband
items.description: Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.

items.name: Greathood
items.description: Hood far larger than the head it is meant to cover. A burial shroud of sorts for those who discover, at long last, the truth they sought.

items.name: Guilty Hood
items.description: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown. The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

items.name: Haima Glintstone Crown
items.description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

items.name: Guardian Mask
items.description: Engraved golden mask.

items.name: Greathelm
items.description: Sturdy greathelm made from iron. Though it is uncomfortably heavy and obstructs the vision of the wearer, it provides considerable damage negation.

items.name: Haligtree Helm
items.description: Helm worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. An iron helm graced by a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.

items.name: Hierodas Glintstone Crown
items.description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP. The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.

items.name: Haligtree Knight Helm
items.description: Helm worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Graced by a crown of unalloyed gold.

items.name: High Page Hood
items.description: Hood of a page selected for special privilege by the noble they serve.

items.name: Highwayman Hood
items.description: Hideously stained and ragged hood. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

items.name: Imp Head (cat)
items.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a cat, it holds trace amounts of feline intelligence.

items.name: Hoslow's Helm
items.description: A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the head of the revered House of Hoslow.

items.name: Iji's Mirrorhelm
items.description: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass, said to have never left War Counselor Iji's head. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

items.name: Imp Head (fanged)
items.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a fanged demon, it holds trace amounts of bestial strength.

items.name: Imp Head (corpse)
items.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling the visage of a corpse, it holds trace amounts of lingering faith.

items.name: Imp Head (elder)
items.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling an elder, it holds trace amounts of arcane knowledge.

items.name: Imp Head (long-tongued)
items.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

items.name: Imp Head (wolf)
items.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a wolf, it holds trace amounts of lupine endurance.

items.name: Incantation Scarab
items.description: Golden scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of incantations during their labors. Slightly reduces the FP costs of incantations, but increases damage taken. As a scarab approaches death, it abandons its rolled treasure and stretches its wings wide for long journey to its home nest.

items.name: Iron Kasa
items.description: Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds.

items.name: Iron Helmet
items.description: An iron helmet showing rust on its edges. Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

items.name: Jar
items.description: Jar that fits cleanly over the head when upturned. Made with pride by Iron Fist Alexander. In a uniquely jarlike gesture of friendship, it boosts the power of throwing pot items.

items.name: Juvenile Scholar Cap
items.description: Cap worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

items.name: Knight Helm
items.description: Iron helm of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

items.name: Land Of Reeds Helm
items.description: Helm made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

items.name: Kaiden Helm
items.description: Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords. These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

items.name: Lazuli Glintstone Crown
items.description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

items.name: Maliketh's Helm
items.description: Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

items.name: Lusat's Glintstone Crown
items.description: The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

items.name: Leyndell Knight Helm
items.description: Helm worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

items.name: Lionel's Helm
items.description: Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

items.name: Malenia's Winged Helm
items.description: Winged helm made of unalloyed gold.

items.name: Malformed Dragon Helm
items.description: A malformed golden helm. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

items.name: Marais Mask
items.description: Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. Increases arcane. The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

items.name: Marionette Soldier Helm
items.description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worm by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

items.name: Leyndell Soldier Helm
items.description: Helm worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

items.name: Marionette Soldier Helm
items.description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

items.name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
items.description: Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird.

items.name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
items.description: Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

items.name: Mushroom Head
items.description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the head.

items.name: Night's Cavalry Helm
items.description: Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

items.name: Mask Of Confidence
items.description: Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread. Increases arcane. When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.

items.name: Navy Hood
items.description: A hooded cloak of deep navy. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases mind. Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

items.name: Night's Cavalry Helm (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Night's Cavalry Helm.

items.name: Mushroom Crown
items.description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms form a towering headpiece. Raises attack power when something nearby suffers from poison or rot. Long ago, great lords served the scarlet rot. Perhaps such fungal bodies served as their crowns.

items.name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
items.description: Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.

items.name: Nox Mirrorhelm
items.description: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass. One among the Eternal City's ritual implements. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks. Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

items.name: Nox Monk Hood
items.description: Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

items.name: Old Aristocrat Cowl
items.description: Cowl made of soft cloth. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

items.name: Nox Swordstress Crown
items.description: Crown worn by the swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

items.name: Okina Mask
items.description: A wooden mask that depicts an old man bearing his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordman of the Land of Reeds. Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.

items.name: Nox Swordstress Crown (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Nox Swordstress Crown.

items.name: Nox Monk Hood (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Nox Monk Hood.

items.name: Octopus Head
items.description: A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head. Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin. Those who can withstand the smell will find its organic elasticity excellent for negating strikes.

items.name: Omen Helm
items.description: Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

items.name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
items.description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP. The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

items.name: Perfumer Hood
items.description: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

items.name: Omensmirk Mask
items.description: Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. Increases strength. Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight. This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.

items.name: Preceptor's Big Hat
items.description: Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

items.name: Prisoner Iron Mask
items.description: Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling. A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

items.name: Queen's Crescent Crown
items.description: A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

items.name: Radahn Soldier Helm
items.description: Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.

items.name: Page Hood
items.description: Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

items.name: Prophet Blindfold
items.description: Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

items.name: Pumpkin Helm
items.description: An oval helmet large enough to cover any head. Very heavy and very hard. Reduces damage from headshots and impacts. The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking. Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

items.name: Radahn's Redmane Helm
items.description: Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair. Worn by General Radahn.

items.name: Ragged Hat (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Ragged Hat.

items.name: Radiant Gold Mask
items.description: A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo. Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism. Strenthens Golden Order incantations. Its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him, and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit. "To you who seek to shine as I do, wear it well!"

items.name: Ragged Hat
items.description: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

items.name: Raya Lucarian Helm
items.description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Its brow adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

items.name: Rotten Duelist Helm
items.description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

items.name: Royal Remains Helm
items.description: Helm graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

items.name: Royal Knight Helm
items.description: Silver helm of Loretta, a Knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

items.name: Redmane Knight Helm
items.description: Helm worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

items.name: Sacred Crown Helm
items.description: Flanged iron cap adorned with a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Who is it that Miquella shall bless, if not the low and the meek?

items.name: Ruler's Mask
items.description: Mask in the image of a wizened sage. Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. Increases faith. Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

items.name: Scaled Helm
items.description: Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

items.name: Shining Horned Headband
items.description: Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

items.name: Sanguine Noble Hood
items.description: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

items.name: Sage Hood
items.description: A burgundy pointed hood. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

items.name: Skeletal Mask
items.description: Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face. Worn by the assassin's of Ravensmount.

items.name: Snow Witch Hat
items.description: Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

items.name: Spellblade's Pointed Hat
items.description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

items.name: Traveling Maiden Hood
items.description: Hood worn by traveling maidens.

items.name: Silver Tear Mask
items.description: Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk. Greatly increases arcane to the detriment of physical attack power. To imitate the imitator is a cunning play indeed.

items.name: Traveler's Hat
items.description: Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

items.name: Vulgar Militia Helm
items.description: Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

items.name: Witch's Glintstone Crown
items.description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

items.name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
items.description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina. Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

items.name: Veteran's Helm
items.description: An old helm that has seen many battles.Worn by Niall, the great veteran general of Sol.

items.name: White Mask
items.description: Bloodstained, faintly grinning mask. Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

items.name: Tree Sentinel Helm
items.description: Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

items.name: Twinned Helm
items.description: Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

items.name: Vagabond Knight Helm
items.description: Helm of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

items.name: Zamor Mask
items.description: Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

items.name: All-knowing Armor
items.description: Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

items.name: Alberich's Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

items.name: All-knowing Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the All-knowing Armor.

items.name: Aristocrat Coat
items.description: Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

items.name: Aristocrat Garb
items.description: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

items.name: Aristocrat Garb (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Aristocrat Garb.

items.name: Alberich's Robe
items.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

items.name: Azur's Glintstone Robe
items.description: A robe reserved for grant masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue-green glintstones.

items.name: Battlemage Robe
items.description: Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

items.name: Banished Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Banished Knight Armor.

items.name: Astrologer Robe
items.description: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

items.name: Bandit Garb
items.description: Leather garb worn by bandits.

items.name: Astrologer Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Astrologer Robe

items.name: Beast Champion Armor
items.description: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

items.name: Black Knife Armor
items.description: Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound. Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

items.name: Beast Champion Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the  Best Champion Armor

items.name: Banished Knight Armor
items.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

items.name: Black Knife Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Black Knife Armor

items.name: Bloodsoaked Tabard
items.description: Padded cloth armor with indelible bloodstains around the neck. Worn by headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

items.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Bloodhound Knight Armor

items.name: Blaidd's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Blaidd's Armor

items.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
items.description: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.  Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

items.name: Blackflame Monk Armor
items.description: Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth.

items.name: Blaidd's Armor
items.description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd

items.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Blue Silver Mail Armor

items.name: Blue Festive Garb
items.description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

items.name: Blue Cloth Vest
items.description: Vest of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting.

items.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
items.description: Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

items.name: Brave's Battlewear
items.description: Battlewear fashioned from leather armor adorned with a large sheet of cloth. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands The red cloth signifies participation in the Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King who led them.

items.name: Briar Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Briar Armor

items.name: Carian Knight Armor
items.description: Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

items.name: Briar Armor
items.description: Battered iron armor from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

items.name: Carian Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Carian Knight Armor

items.name: Brave's Battlewear (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Brave's Battlewear

items.name: Chain Armor
items.description: Armor made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

items.name: Champion Pauldron
items.description: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

items.name: Bull-goat Armor
items.description: Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

items.name: Chain-draped Tabard
items.description: Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

items.name: Cloth Garb
items.description: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

items.name: Cleanrot Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Cleanrot Armor

items.name: Commoner's Garb (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Garb

items.name: Cleanrot Armor
items.description: Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

items.name: Commoner's Garb
items.description: Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

items.name: Confessor Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Confessor Armor

items.name: Confessor Armor
items.description: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

items.name: Commoner's Simple Garb
items.description: Garb with a modest cloth cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

items.name: Commoner's Simple Garb (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Simple Garb

items.name: Consort's Robe
items.description: Fine robe of white silk worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor.

items.name: Crucible Axe Armor
items.description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

items.name: Corhyn's Robe
items.description: Robe of Corhyn the cleric. Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

items.name: Crucible Tree Armor
items.description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Siluria and her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

items.name: Crucible Axe Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Crucible Axe Armor

items.name: Crucible Tree Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Crucible Tree Armor

items.name: Cuckoo Surcoat
items.description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone. To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.

items.name: Cuckoo Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

items.name: Cuckoo Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Cuckoo Knight Armor

items.name: Deathbed Dress
items.description: Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead. Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer. The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.

items.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
items.description: Robe worn by depraved perfumers. The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is  what earned them their name.

items.name: Drake Knight Armor
items.description: Black iron armor worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partake of communion. The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

items.name: Drake Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Drake Knight Armor

items.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Depraved Perfumer Robe

items.name: Elden Lord Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Elden Lord Armor

items.name: Elden Lord Armor
items.description: Armor of Godfrey the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

items.name: Dirty Chainmail
items.description: Chainmail worn by young Albinaurics. The appearance of a protruding belly provides no benefits worthy of note.

items.name: Errant Sorcerer Robe
items.description: Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

items.name: Erdtree Surcoat
items.description: Armor worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The surcoat bears a majestic likeness of the Erdtree. Its golden backing is an honor bestowed on no other soldiers.

items.name: Eccentric's Armor
items.description: Unusually colorful armor. Worn by the knight Jerren. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath

items.name: Eye Surcoat
items.description: Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.

items.name: Festive Garb
items.description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Faintly bloodstained.

items.name: Errant Sorcerer Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Errant Sorcerer Robe.

items.name: Festive Garb (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the  Festive Garb.

items.name: Fia's Robe
items.description: Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

items.name: Fell Omen Cloak
items.description: "A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen.

items.name: Exile Armor
items.description: Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

items.name: Finger Maiden Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Finger Maiden Robe.

items.name: Finger Maiden Robe
items.description: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

items.name: Fingerprint Armor
items.description: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

items.name: Fingerprint Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Fingerprint Armor.

items.name: Fur Raiment
items.description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

items.name: Gelmir Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard.

items.name: Gelmir Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Gelmir Knight Armor.

items.name: Fire Prelate Armor
items.description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

items.name: Godrick Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick The Grafted.

items.name: Godksin Noble Robe
items.description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles known for their seven-face aprons. Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

items.name: Fire Prelate Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Fire Prelate Armor.

items.name: Foot Soldier Tabard
items.description: Padded cloth armor with more than a few stains. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

items.name: Fire Monk Armor
items.description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Monks.

items.name: Godrick Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Godric Knight Armor.

items.name: Goldmask's Rags
items.description: Worn rags that just barely cover the body. Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excess of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?

items.name: Gravekeeper Cloak
items.description: Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

items.name: Godskin Apostle Robe
items.description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.

items.name: Haligtree Crest Surcoat
items.description: Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. The surcoat bears the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

items.name: Gravekeeper Cloak (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Gravekeeper Cloak.

items.name: Guardian Garb
items.description: Engraved golden garb. Worn by guardians of the Minor Erdtree.

items.name: Haligtree Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by knights sworn the Haligtree.

items.name: Guardian Garb (full Bloom)
items.description: Engraved golden garb. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation. It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already

items.name: Haligtree Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Haligtree Knight Armor.

items.name: High Page Clothes
items.description: Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve.

items.name: Highwayman Cloth Armor
items.description: Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

items.name: High Page Clothes (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the High Page Clothes.

items.name: Hoslow's Armor
items.description: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

items.name: Ivory-draped Tabard
items.description: Padded cloth armor with a shawl in the color of ivory draped over the shoulders. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

items.name: Knight Armor
items.description: Iron armor of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

items.name: Juvenile Scholar Robe
items.description: Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

items.name: Kaiden Armor
items.description: Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.

items.name: Land Of Reeds Armor
items.description: Armor made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

items.name: Hoslow's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Hoslow's Armor.

items.name: Lazuli Robe
items.description: Robe worn by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus, singular among the greater Raya Lucaria Academy. These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars. This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.

items.name: Leather Armor
items.description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier.

items.name: Leather-draped Tabard
items.description: Padded cloth armor with a leather shawl draped over the shoulders.

items.name: Lionel's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Lionel's Armor.

items.name: Leyndell Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Leyndell Knight Armor.

items.name: Leyndell Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.

items.name: Lionel's Armor
items.description: Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back. Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted.

items.name: Lord Of Blood's Robe
items.description: Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth. The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

items.name: Lusat's Robe
items.description: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue glintstones.

items.name: Lord Of Blood's Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Lord Of Blood's Robe.

items.name: Malenia's Armor
items.description: Armor made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god - he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

items.name: Maliketh's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Maliketh's Armor.

items.name: Malenia's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Maleinia's Armor.

items.name: Malformed Dragon Armor
items.description: Malformed golden armor. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

items.name: Maliketh's Armor
items.description: Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

items.name: Marionette Soldier Armor
items.description: Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

items.name: Marais Robe
items.description: Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

items.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve theirs masters in death.

items.name: Mausoleum Surcoat
items.description: Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

items.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Mausoleum Knight Armor

items.name: Mushroom Body
items.description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the torso. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

items.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Nomadic Merchant's Finery

items.name: Night's Cavalry Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Night's Cavalry Armor

items.name: Night's Cavalry Armor
items.description: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

items.name: Night Maiden Armor
items.description: Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

items.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
items.description: Finery of the nomadic merchants.

items.name: Noble's Traveling Garb
items.description: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

items.name: Nox Monk Armor
items.description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

items.name: Nox Swordstress Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Nox Swordstress Armor.

items.name: Nox Monk Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Nox Monk Armor.

items.name: Nox Swordstress Armor
items.description: Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

items.name: Omen Armor
items.description: Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

items.name: Official's Attire
items.description: Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks. Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals... The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.

items.name: Page Garb
items.description: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

items.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
items.description: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

items.name: Page Garb (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Page Garb.

items.name: Perfumer Robe
items.description: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

items.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Perfumer's Traveling Garb.

items.name: Perfumer Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Perfurmer's Robe.

items.name: Omenkiller Robe
items.description: Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.

items.name: Old Aristocrat Gown
items.description: Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

items.name: Preceptor's Long Gown (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Preceptor's Long Gown.

items.name: Preceptor's Long Gown
items.description: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

items.name: Prophet Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Prophet Robe.

items.name: Queen's Robe
items.description: Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

items.name: Prophet Robe
items.description: Robe of exiled prophets who foresaw that their faith would end in flames — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Its fabric scrapes against their skin like a file, and the rickety cart wheel around the neck warns passers-by not to lend an ear to their meandering sermons.

items.name: Prisoner Clothing
items.description: Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

items.name: Ragged Armor
items.description: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

items.name: Ragged Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Ragged Armor.

items.name: Radahn's Lion Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Radahn's Lion Armor.

items.name: Radahn's Lion Armor
items.description: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

items.name: Raging Wolf Armor (altered)
items.description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

items.name: Raya Lucarian Robe
items.description: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep blue garb along with their vows of virtue and austerity. But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

items.name: Raging Wolf Armor
items.description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

items.name: Redmane Surcoat
items.description: Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.

items.name: Ronin's Armor
items.description: Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

items.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
items.description: Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.

items.name: Redmane Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Redmane Knight Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

items.name: Ronin's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Ronin's Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

items.name: Redmane Knight Armor
items.description: Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

items.name: Raptor's Black Feathers
items.description: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassin Ravenmount.

items.name: Royal Knight Armor
items.description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

items.name: Royal Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Royal Knight Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

items.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak.

items.name: Royal Remains Armor
items.description: Armory graces with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

items.name: Scaled Armor
items.description: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks.

items.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
items.description: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

items.name: Ruler's Robe
items.description: Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation. Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.

items.name: Scaled Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Scaled Armor

items.name: Sage Robe
items.description: Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

items.name: Scale Armor
items.description: Armor reinforced with small metal scales. The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

items.name: Traveling Maiden Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Traveling Maiden Robe

items.name: Snow Witch Robe (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Snow Witch Robe

items.name: Scarlet Tabard
items.description: Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot. Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army

items.name: Shaman Furs
items.description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

items.name: Traveling Maiden Robe
items.description: Robe worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

items.name: Snow Witch Robe
items.description: Witch's robe in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

items.name: Tree Sentinel Armor
items.description: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

items.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Spellblade's Traveling Attire

items.name: Traveler's Clothes
items.description: Light yet sturdy clothes.

items.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
items.description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

items.name: Tree Sentinel Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Tree Sentinel Armor

items.name: Twinned Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Twinned Armor

items.name: Vagabond Knight Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Vagabond Knight Armor

items.name: Vagabond Knight Armor
items.description: Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.  Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

items.name: Veteran's Armor
items.description: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

items.name: Twinned Armor
items.description: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

items.name: Veteran's Armor (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the Veteran's Armor

items.name: Tree Surcoat
items.description: Blue surcoat draped over chainmail. The tree insignia emblazoned on the front depicts the Erdtree, and is a design beloved throughout the Lands Between.

items.name: Upper-class Robe
items.description: Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

items.name: Tree-and-beast Surcoat
items.description: Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage. Both are symbols of glory now past.

items.name: Vulgar Militia Armor
items.description: Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

items.name: White Reed Armor
items.description: Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

items.name: War Surgeon Gown
items.description: "Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception."

items.name: War Surgeon Gown (altered)
items.description: Lighter version of the War Surgeon Gown.

items.name: Zamor Armor
items.description: Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

items.name: All-knowing Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

items.name: Azur's Manchettes
items.description: Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

items.name: Battlemage Manchettes
items.description: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

items.name: Astrologer Gloves
items.description: Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

items.name: Bandit Manchettes
items.description: Manchettes made by simple wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. Worn by bandits.

items.name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

items.name: Alberich's Bracers
items.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.

items.name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
items.description: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

items.name: Black Knife Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

items.name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
items.description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

items.name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
items.description: Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

items.name: Brave's Bracer
items.description: Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

items.name: Briar Gauntlets
items.description: Battered iron gauntlets from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

items.name: Bull-goat Gauntlets
items.description: Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

items.name: Bloodsoaked Manchettes
items.description: Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.

items.name: Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.

items.name: Blue Silver Bracelets
items.description: Bracelets crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

items.name: Carian Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen,  were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

items.name: Chain Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

items.name: Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Time has yet to dull their luster.

items.name: Confessor Gloves
items.description: Black leather gloves of the church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

items.name: Cleanrot Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

items.name: Champion Bracers
items.description: Bracers reserved for the bandlands' bravest.  Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.  Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

items.name: Depraved Perfumer Gloves
items.description: Gloves worn by depraved perfumers.

items.name: Champion Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

items.name: Elden Lord Bracers
items.description: Bracers of Godfrey the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

items.name: Eccentric's Manchettes
items.description: The knight Jerren's manchettes. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

items.name: Drake Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe

items.name: Crucible Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

items.name: Errant Sorcerer Manchettes
items.description: Commonplace leather manchettes. Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.

items.name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
items.description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Fire Monks.

items.name: Godrick Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Time has yet to dull their luster.

items.name: Gelmir Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Time has yet to dull their luster.

items.name: Foot Soldier Gauntlets
items.description: Metal gauntlets covered in nicks and dents. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

items.name: Exile Gauntlets
items.description: Damaged iron gauntlets. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

items.name: Fingerprint Gauntlets
items.description: Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

items.name: Godrick Soldier Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

items.name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
items.description: Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

items.name: Godskin Apostle Bracelets
items.description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Apostles.

items.name: Highwayman Gauntlets
items.description: Hideously stained and dented gauntlets. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

items.name: Godskin Noble Bracelets
items.description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

items.name: Haligtree Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

items.name: Haligtree Knight Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Time has yet to dull their luster.

items.name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
items.description: Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family.

items.name: Kaiden Gauntlets
items.description: Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords.

items.name: Iron Gauntlets
items.description: Ordinary iron gauntlets.

items.name: Gold Bracelets
items.description: Bracelets made in the image of Erdtree branches. Minimal adornments made my Lord Goldmask's disciples. Those disciples have long since left him.

items.name: Guardian Bracers
