items.description: Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.
items.effects: Incinerates area before caster with stream of fire

items.name: Shadow Bait
items.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' sewants, who once served as the
items.effects: Creates shadow that lures the aggression of foes of human build

items.name: Scouring Black Flame
items.description: A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles. Sweeps a wide area before the caster with black flame. Charging enhances range. The black flame could once slay gods. But when Maliketh sealed Destined Death, the true power of the black flame was lost.
items.effects: Sweeps area before caster with black flame

items.name: Scarlet Aeonia
items.description: Technique of Malenia, the Goddess of Rot.
items.effects: Creates a giant flower that explodes with scarlet rot.

items.name: Swarm Of Flies
items.description: A Blood Oath incantation, shared from the Lord of Blood's power. Releases a swarm of bloodflies before the caster to assault foes. The vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss. This incantation can be cast while in motion. The new palace of the Lord of Blood lies in a swamp of festering blood, and these flies are said to spawn from excrement in that land.
items.effects: Releases a swarm of bloodflies before the caster

items.name: The Flame Of Frenzy
items.description: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.
items.effects: Emits burst of yellow flame of frenzy from eyes

items.name: Theodorix's Magma
items.description: Superior incantation of Dragon Communion. Channels the power of the great wyrm Theodorix. Transforms caster into a great wyrm to spew a large volume of magma breath. Allows one follow-up attack. The name of the ancient troll warrior Theodorix lives on — as a hero of the War against the Giants.
items.effects: Spews magma breath of Theodorix from above

items.name: Unendurable Frenzy
items.description: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers. Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to violently burst forth from the caster's eyes. Hold to continue channeling the flame. This incantation can be used while in motion. It is the maddening pain and unstoppable tears of those afflicted with the flame of frenzy brought into being.
items.effects: Emits violent burst of yellow flame of frenzy from eyes.

items.name: Triple Rings Of Light
items.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Produces three rings of light and fires them forwards. The rings of light return to a position close to the caster before disappearing. This incantation can be cast repeatedly. A gift from the young Ivliquella to his father, Radagon.
items.effects: Fire three rings of light before the caster

items.name: Whirl, O Flame!
items.description: Superior Incantation of the Fire Monks.
items.effects: Sweeps area before caster with stream of fire

items.name: Vyke's Dragonbolt
items.description: Incantation of Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.
items.effects: Enchants right-hand armament with lightning damage

items.name: Urgent Heal
items.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers faithful.
items.effects: Heals a small amount of HP.

items.name: Wrath Of Gold
items.description: Superior Erdtree Worship incantation. Produces a golden shockwave that knocks back nearby foes. Charging increases the size of the shockwave. This incantation was discovered when the Elden Ring was shattered, and it was feared as a sign of the Erdtree's wrath.
items.effects: Produces golden shockwave that knocks back foes

items.name: Finger Seal
items.description: A sacred seal given by maidens of the Finger Readers which serves as a catalyst for casting sacred incantations. Incantations must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a sacred seal must be equipped to cast them.

items.name: Godslayer's Seal
items.description: Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian. Said to represent the manipulation of black flame, this catalyst enhances godslayer incantations.

items.name: Giant's Seal
items.description: Sacred seal depicting the one eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair. Sacred seal wielded by Fire Monks and Prelates, this catalyst enhances Giants' Flame incantations.

items.name: Clawmark Seal
items.description: A sacred seal given by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. A rare trinket which allows incantations to be scaled with strength.  The claw mark represents Gurranq's wrath. Enhances bestial incantations learned from Gurranq.

items.name: Golden Order Seal
items.description: A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order. Enhances Golden Fundamentalist incantations.  Fundamentalism is scholarship in all but name. Scales incantation using both intelligence and faith.

items.name: Erdtree Seal
items.description: A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between. Even though the Elden Ring is shattered, and the Erdtree has dulled from its former radiance, earnest faith continues to hold the answers.

items.name: Dragon Communion Seal
items.description: Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest. Enhances Dragon Communion incantations. The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power. Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term "incantation" to be appropriate. This seal scales incantations with one's arcane attribute.

items.name: Frenzied Flame Seal
items.description: Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers. Enhances incantations of the frenzied flame. This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame. Scales incantations using strength, dexterity, intelligence, and faith all together.

items.name: Gravel Stone Seal
items.description: Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale. Enhances Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital. The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lightning itself, are both imbued with gold.

items.name: Buckler
items.description: A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center enables parrying techniques. A well-timed parry can break an enemy's stance, allowing a critical hit. Best suited for those prepared to take the risk to reap their reward.

items.name: Perfumer's Shield
items.description: Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service. Made to be thin and light of weight, even those lacking strength can employ this immunity-boosting shield.

items.name: Man-serpent's Shield
items.description: Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir. Said to have been tempered in lava, it boasts great resistance to fire.

items.name: Pillory Shield
items.description: Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such. Perhaps due to its use as a device with which the guilty were made to endure prolonged suffering, it raises vitality.

items.name: Rickety Shield
items.description: A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines or some such. There are countless other shields available of better make. This piece of scrap isn't worth the effort of equipping.

items.name: Beastman's Jar-shield
items.description: Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it. The beastmen have always fired earthenware jars for the express purpose of making shields. Such are their ways, strange though they are.

items.name: Red Thorn Roundshield
items.description: A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to use, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield. Its emblem is an ancient red thorn design. Though it isn't much, it boosts fire damage negation.

items.name: Riveted Wooden Shield
items.description: Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield. The design riveted to the center represents both sword and tree.

items.name: Scripture Wooden Shield
items.description: A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield. An ancient cipher engraving linesd the circumference. Though it isn't much, it boosts holy damage negation.

items.name: Blue-white Wooden Shield
items.description: Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield. The design is said to represent the stars of the night sky, portending fate.

items.name: Rift Shield
items.description: Small metal roundshiled depicting a sinister rift. An antiquated charm that glares back at an enemy, it boosts focus.

items.name: Iron Roundshield
items.description: An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation. Finely balanced, this shield is easy to use.

items.name: Smoldering Shield
items.description: Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava. Resists frost with its heat, and can even be used to deal fire damage if wielded as a weapon.

items.name: Gilded Iron Shield
items.description: Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation. Though the gold leaf is peeling and the effect is slight, it still boosts holy damage negation.

items.name: Ice Crest Shield
items.description: Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation. The ice crest originates from a Carian princess. Thogh the effect is slight, it boosts magic damage negation and resistance to frost.

items.name: Spiralhorn Shield
items.description: Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss. Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancestral followers. Though the effect is only slight, it boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.

items.name: Marred Leather Shield
items.description: Leather shield of Stormveil soldiers. Miuch like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns. Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.

items.name: Marred Wooden Shield
items.description: "Wooden shield of the Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns. Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle."

items.name: Coil Shield
items.description: An extremely odd shield adorned with a coiled bronze snake. An excellent choice for attention-seekers. This Shield provides an effective defense against poison - after all, how does one poison a poisonous snake?

items.name: Kite Shield
items.description: A standard medium-sized metal shield. Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.

items.name: Banished Knight's Shield
items.description: A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

items.name: Albinauric Shield
items.description: Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created. Boasts exceptional magic damage negation. The Albinaurics' most formidable foes were sorcerers, after all.

items.name: Sun Realm Shield
items.description: Shield of honor depicting a city crowned by the sun. It has seen better days. Much like the wear upon the shield, the Seat of the Sun is long faded away.

items.name: Silver Mirrorshield
items.description: Shield of radiant silver, festooned with amber and carried by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree. The shape is said to imitate that of a sacred drop of dew, which inspired the absurd rumor that Loretta herself was an Albinauric.

items.name: Round Shield
items.description: A wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. Comparatively light for its size, this shield is easy to handle but lacks a true metal shield's ability to negate damage.

items.name: Scorpion Kite Shield
items.description: A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability. Emblazoned with a yellow scorpion, a warning of surprise attacks and sudden strikes.

items.name: Twinbird Kite Shield
items.description: Shield featuring a vividly painted twinbird. The twinbird is said to be the envoy of an outer god, and mother of the Deathbirds. At dwindling levels of HP, this shield slightly boosts both attack and defense.

items.name: Blue-gold Kite Shield
items.description: A standard medium-sized shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability. The design represents the Erdtree foreground against a blue sky.

items.name: Brass Shield
items.description: On the larger side for medium-sized shield, the face has been covered in brass. Commonly employed in the Shattering.

items.name: Shield Of The Guilty
items.description: Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands. Venerating the repose of the soul, this shield boosts focus. The briars can be used to attack foes.

items.name: Great Turtle Shell
items.description: Shield fashioned from a great turtle shell. The natural curve helps it contend with foes' attacks. The turtle is a symbol of tirelessness, and this shield boosts stamina recovery speed.

items.name: Carian Knight's Shield
items.description: A teardrop-shaped shield embedded with blue glintstones. Carried by knights who served the Carian royal family. Excels when facing magic or holy attacks. Just who were these knights preparing to fight?

items.name: Horse Crest Wooden Shield
items.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. The circular horsehead design evokes a swift gallop.

items.name: Candletree Wooden Shield
items.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Thought to represent a surreptitious prophecy of cardinal sin, the lit candle-tree design was forbidden.

items.name: Large Leather Shield
items.description: A round shield covered in leather. One of the larger categories of medium-sized shield. Though its damage negation may be lacking compared to a metal shield, it can handle wider range of attack affinities.

items.name: Flame Crest Wooden Shield
items.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Carried by soldiers of the village that is afflicted by frenzy. The yellow flame is the symbol of the affliction, serving as a warning to those who might approach the village.

items.name: Hawk Crest Wooden Shield
items.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Adorned with a long-forgotten crest of Stormveil, ancient in design.

items.name: Beast Crest Heater Shield
items.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. Features a beast as its crest, serving to remind warriors not to succumb to the arousal of battle. Fight with passion, but become nor its prisoner.

items.name: Red Crest Heater Shield
items.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The crest symbolizes red wings.

items.name: Eclipse Crest Heater Shield
items.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The sun in eclipse is said to be the symbol of the Wandering Mausoleum where the soulless demigods slumber.

items.name: Blue Crest Heater Shield
items.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The crest represents a forest and river.

items.name: Inverted Hawk Heater Shield
items.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The inverted hawk is the emblem of the company of slaves ordered to explore the Eternal City.

items.name: Heater Shield
items.description: A medium-sized metal shield, comparatively easy to handle. Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.

items.name: Black Leather Shield
items.description: Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield. From the north, this shield depicts the polar star in rivets of gold. The inside is lined with fur, protecting the carrier from frost.

items.name: Dragon Towershield
items.description: Tower shield engraved with a dragon, symbol of protection. Heavy even among greatshields, it possesses exceptional guarding ability The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.

items.name: Crucible Hornshield
items.description: Greatshield of red-tinged gold carried by Crucible Knights. Features a great horn. An ancient holiness dwells within. The crucible horn skewers foes when performing shield bashes.

items.name: Distinguished Greatshield
items.description: Greatshield featuring sumptuous ornamentation used by the scions of great families. Due to their excessive size, these shields were at times seen as the hallmark of little lordlings who were too timid to earn a few nicks and scratches.

items.name: Dragonclaw Shield
items.description: Greatshield said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Edrtree. Imbued with lightning.

items.name: Golden Beast Crest Shield
items.description: Shield of dull gold with a beast engraved as its crest. Lighter than most greratshields, and subsequently easier to wield. The beast depicted is Serosh, aged counselor who guides the golden lineage.

items.name: Erdtree Greatshield
items.description: Weighty greatshield forged of gold carried by the order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Blessed by an old incantation of protection. The living rampart of the Erdtree, the Tree Sentinels are the standard to which all defenders of the Erdtree aspire.

items.name: Briar Greatshield
items.description: Greatshield from a foreign land, used by Elemer of the Briar. Attacks with this armament utilize the iron thorns that have been wound around its frame. Originates from Eochaid, a land of proudly solitary ascetics.

items.name: Jellyfish Shield
items.description: The head of a spirit jellyfish, commonly found floating above sacred ground throughout the Lands Between, wielded without modification as a shield. The see-through head is extremely light, but its flesh is supple, providing absolutely no protection from piercing attacks

items.name: Fingerprint Stone Shield
items.description: A great stone shield with an intricately carved fingerprint design. One of the heaviest of all greatshields. Part of the tomb of an ancient god, the Readerless Fingers relayed their message through these imprints, said to be the very seeds from which frenzy first sprouted.

items.name: Icon Shield
items.description: Greatshield painted with a divine scene; the recipients of a blessed tear from the Erdtree. An item that looks back fondly on the age of plenty. The divine scene acts in and of itself as a sacred invocation; gradually restoring the carrier's HP.

items.name: Visage Shield
items.description: Tricksome bronze shield depicting the face of a Fire Giant. Several tongues leap from its open mouth. The dreadful visage and burning flames are designed to remind one of the horror of facing a Fire Giant. In other words, this shield has an instructional function.

items.name: One-eyed Shield
items.description: Tricksome shield made from white stone depicting a malformed one-eyed god. The barrel of a firearm pokes through the open mouth. Once worshipped by the giants, this evil deity is believed to have been slain by Queen Marika.

items.name: Spiked Palisade Shield
items.description: Designed to perform shield bashes, these attacks riddle the enemy with holes, earning it the nickname of "pard shield"

items.name: Manor Towershield
items.description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Depicts the Roundtable Hold, gathering place of champions. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

items.name: Crossed-tree Towershield
items.description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Emblazoned with an old, interleaving tree. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel

items.name: Redmane Greatshield
items.description: Greatshield shaped like a fang, featuring the crest of red-maned lion. Carried by the Redmane Knights who fought alongside Radahn.

items.name: Ant's Skull Plate
items.description: Huge head of one of the giant ants which inhabit the two underground rivers, used without modification as a shield. Excels at repeling enemy attacks. Giant ants are venomous creatures, granting a boost to immunity when wielding the shield.

items.name: Inverted Hawk Towershield
items.description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Features an inverted hawk crest. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

items.name: Eclipse Crest Greatshield
items.description: Metal greatshield painted with a sun in eclipse. Carried by the headless mausoleum knights. The eclipsed sun, drained of color, is the protective star of soulless demigods. It aids the mausoleum knights by keeping Destined Death at bay. No skill. This armament has no skill. If the armament in the other hand has a skill, that skill will be used instead.

items.name: Cuckoo Greatshield
items.description: Metal Greatshield painted with a peering cuckoo. Carried by the enchanted knights sworn to the academy. Boasting high magic damage negation, this shield is used to hunt down mages. Our Enemys is none other then caria itself

items.name: Gilded Greatshield
items.description: Metal greatshield coated with gold. Carried by knights loyal to Godrick. The red tinge in the gold coat mirrors the primordial matter that became the Erdtree. The color of homeward yearning.

items.name: Golden Greatshield
items.description: Oval greatshield made of gold, carried by knights who protect the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Knights of Leyndell are reputed for their sturdiness, exemplified by this shield's exceptional guard capacity.

items.name: Haligtree Crest Greatshield
items.description: Metal greatshield depicting the Haligtree with unalloyed gold. Carried by knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. Possesses high holy damage negation. Yet now, with the Haligtree misshapen, this wondrous rendition is a fleeting fantasy.

items.name: Wooden Greatshield
items.description: Wooden greatshield reinforced with a metal ornamentation. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

items.name: Lordsworn's Shield
items.description: Wooden tower shield. Lightweightfor a greatshield and easy to handle. Commonly used in the Shattering. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

items.name: Briars Of Punishment
items.description: An aberrant sorcery discovered by exiled criminals. Theirs are the sorceries most reviled by the academy. Wounds the caster with thorns of sin, sending a trail of bloodthorns running over the ground to impale enemies from below. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.
items.effects: Wounds caster to unleash trail of bloodthrorns

items.name: Ancient Death Rancor
items.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death.
items.effects: Summons horde of vengeful spirits that chase down foes

items.name: Briars Of Sin
items.description: An aberrant sorcery, discovered along with red glintstone by those exiled to the north for their crimes. Summons large thorns from a whorl of blood shed by one's own hand in penance for sins. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. The Academy reviles this sorcery, which draws its power from faith.
items.effects: Summons thorns from a whorl of your own blood.

items.name: Cannon Of Haima
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Lobs an explosive magic projectile that flies in an arc. Charging enhances potency. Drawn from the conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
items.effects: Lobs an explosive magic projectile in an arc

items.name: Ambush Shard
items.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Launches a projectile from a distance removed from the caster, so as to strike the enemy from behind. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
items.effects: Strikes from behind with projectile fired from distance

items.name: Carian Phalanx
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Forms a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades

items.name: Adula's Moonblade
items.description: Sorcery of Adula, the Glintstone Dragon. Conjures a cold magic greatsword, then delivers a sweeping blow that launches a blade-like projectile of frost. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. Adula, a devourer of sorcerers, was bested by Ranni and subsequently swore a knightly oath to her Dark Moon.
items.effects: Sweeping slash followed by cold blade projectile

items.name: Carian Greatsword
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Conjures a magic greatsword and then delivers a sweeping blow. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. Armed with this spell, sorcerers gain the strength of knights, their loyalty sworn to the moon.
items.effects: Performs sweeping slash using magical greatsword

items.name: Carian Piercer
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Impales foes with magical greatsword

items.name: Carian Retaliation
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Dispels enemy spells and retaliates with glintblades

items.name: Carian Slicer
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Performs swift sweeping slash using magical sword

items.name: Crystal Barrage
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards

items.name: Collapsing Stars
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
items.effects: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile volley

items.name: Comet Azur
items.description: Legendary sorcery devised by Azur, primeval sorcerer. Fires a tremendous comet in a torrent akin to the distant starry expanse, the place said to be the origin of glintstone. Hold to continue releasing the sorcery's power. When Azur glimpsed into the primeval current, he saw darkness. He was left both bewitched and fearful of the abyss.
items.effects: Fires a tremendous comet within a starry torrent

items.name: Crystal Burst
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging increases potency. A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursued the wisdom of stone - the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.
items.effects: Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards

items.name: Comet
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a great magical comet. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. The greatest of the Karolos Conspectus's sorceries, that only a very few sorcerers have ever mastered.
items.effects: Fires a great magic comet

items.name: Crystal Torrent
items.description: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.
items.effects: Creates crystal mass that fires stream of crystal shards

items.name: Crystal Release
items.description: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it to scour a wide area with a violent rain of crystal shards. This sorcery is used by high-ranking adepts among the Crystalians. Some also call this sorcery "the Crystal Sun."
items.effects: Scours area with violent rain of crystal shards

items.name: Fia's Mist
items.description: Sorcery of Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Creates a deathly mist before the caster, which inflicts Death blight upon those who enter. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist. This sorcery was developed to oppose the Roundtable Hold, and is effective only against the Tarnished.
items.effects: Release a mist of death before caster

items.name: Eternal Darkness
items.description: Forbidden sorcery of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
items.effects: Creates a dark space that draws in spells

items.name: Frozen Armament
items.description: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch. Enchants armament held in the right hand with frost. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
items.effects: Enchants right-hand armament with frost

items.name: Founding Rain Of Stars
items.description: The eldest primeval sorcery, said to have been discovered by an
items.effects: Releases a downpour of star rain for a while

items.name: Explosive Ghostflame
items.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death.
items.effects: Causes ghostflame explosion that burns wide area

items.name: Freezing Mist
items.description: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
items.effects: Releases cold mist before caster

items.name: Gelmir's Fury
items.description: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
items.effects: Covers area with surge of magma from the earth

items.name: Gavel Of Haima
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Creates a magical greathammer and slams it down. Allows one follow-up attack. Drawn from the scholarly conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
items.effects: Attacks using a magic greathammer

items.name: Glintstone Arc
items.description: Fires a horizontal arc of magic that spreads outward. This sorcery can be cast repeteadly and while in motion.
items.effects: Fires a horizontally-widening magic arc

items.name: Glintstone Cometshard
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a magical comet with a trailing tail. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy.
items.effects: Fires a magic comet with a trailing tail

items.name: Glintstone Pebble
items.description: The most basic glintstone sorcery of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Fires magic projectiles from glintstone

items.name: Glintstone Stars
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Fires three shooting stars that pursue foes

items.name: Glintstone Icecrag
items.description: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
items.effects: Fires mass of cold magic from glintstone

items.name: Glintblade Phalanx
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Forms a defensive arch of magic glintblades

items.name: Gravity Well
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Fires a projectile of condensed gravitational force. Those struck by it will be pulled toward the caster. Charging enhances potency. A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.
items.effects: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile

items.name: Great Glintstone Shard
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching large magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
items.effects: Fires larger magic projectiles from glintstone

items.name: Lucidity
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Alleviates buildup of sleep and madness

items.name: Greatblade Phalanx
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Creates a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes. Used by the enchanted troll knights. They were the comrades of the young Rennala, bound by oath.
items.effects: Forms a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades

items.name: Great Oracular Bubble
items.description: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient
items.effects: Launches a large magic bubble

items.name: Oracle Bubble
items.description: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty.
items.effects: Launches several bubbles of magic.

items.name: Loretta's Greatbow
items.description: Sorcery used by Royal Knight Loretta. Creates a magic greatbow and fires a great arrow. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrow nocked. It is said that the bow was Loretta's favored weapon.
items.effects: Fires great arrow from a magic greatbow

items.name: Loretta's Mastery
items.description: Sorcery used by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree. Creates a magic greatbow and fires four great arrows simultaneously. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrows nocked. Developed by Loretta after her long, bloody journey to seek out a place where the Albinaurics could live in peace.
items.effects: Fires four great arrow from a magic greatbow at once

items.name: Magic Downpour
items.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
items.effects: Summon a magic mass that sprays projectiles over area

items.name: Magic Glintblade
items.description: An old sorcery of the Carian Royal Family.
items.effects: Creates sigil that forms a projectile glintblade after delay

items.name: Magma Shot
items.description: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
items.effects: Fire lump of magma that explodes on contact

items.name: Meteorite
items.description: A glintstone sorcery that draws on gravitational force, used by a great white king with stone skin. Calls small meteorites down from the sky. The meteor shower continues for as long as the sorcery is in effect. It is said that, in the Eternal City, now lost in ruin underground, meteorites held the same import as stars.
items.effects: Calls small meteors down from the sky.

items.name: Night Comet
items.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
items.effects: Fires semi-invisible magic comet

items.name: Meteorite Of Astel
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Summons a void that emits a hail of meteorites. Hold to continue the effect. A manifestation of the power with which Astel leveled the Eternal City.
items.effects: Calls a hail of small meteorites from the void.

items.name: Night Shard
items.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
items.effects: Swiftly fires a semi-invisible

items.name: Night Maiden's Mist
items.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
items.effects: Releases life-sapping silver mist before caster

items.name: Rancorcall
items.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death.
items.effects: Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes

items.name: Oracle Bubbles
items.description: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient
items.effects: Launches several small magic bubbles.

items.name: Rennala's Full Moon
items.description: Sorcery associated with the Carian queen. Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a full moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The full moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes. Queen Rennala encountered this enchanting moon when she was young, and later, it would bewitch the academy.
items.effects: Incarnate a full moon and launch it at foes

items.name: Ranni's Dark Moon
items.description: Legendary sorcery associated with the Carian queen.
items.effects: Incarnate a cold, dark moon and launch it at foes.

items.name: Rock Blaster
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Thurst staff into ground to emit a massive shockwave

items.name: Roiling Magma
items.description: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir. Fires a lump of condensed magma that explodes a short delay after hitting the target. Charging enhances potency and further delays the explosion. After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.
items.effects: Fires lump of magma that explodes after delay

items.name: Rykard's Rancor
items.description: The terrible power of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.
items.effects: Releases searing spirits that repeatedly explode after delay

items.name: Rock Sling
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
items.effects: Summons rocks from the earth and sends its flying

items.name: Scholar's Armament
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Enchants right-hand armament with magic damage

items.name: Scholar's Shield
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Enhances left-handed shield damage negation

items.name: Shard Spiral
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Fire twin spiraling projectiles

items.name: Shatter Earth
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a magical shockwave. Allows one follow-up attack. A Stonedigger sorcery used by the glintstone miners of the crystal tunnel. At the academy, use of this sorcery was a stigma that marked out failed scholars.
items.effects: Thrust staff into ground to emit a shockwave

items.name: Starlight
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
items.effects: Creates star light to illuminate surroundings

items.name: Star Shower
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires six magic shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency. The most difficult to master of the Olivinus Conspectus sorceries.
items.effects: Fires six shooting stars that pursue foes

items.name: Stars Of Ruin
items.description: Legendary sorcery devised by Lusat, primeval sorcerers.
items.effects: Fire twelve dark shooting stars that pursue foes

items.name: Shattering Crystal
items.description: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it in a forward burst. Charging enhances potency. The Crystalians are inorganic beings, yet they live. They cleave close to the ideals of the primeval current, and as such, they are revered guests of the sorcerers.
items.effects: Creates crystal mass that shatters in forward burst

items.name: Swift Glintstone Shard
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching swift magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action. Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
items.effects: Swiftly fires magic projectiles from glintstone

items.name: Terra Magicus
items.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Draws an academy sigil upon the ground, raising the magic strength of those within. Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spell—casting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.
items.effects: Raises the magic strength of those within the sigil

items.name: Unseen Blade
items.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Enchants armament held in right hand, making it completely invisible. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Used by Sellian assassins to present themselves as unarmed sorcerers.
items.effects: Makes right-hand armament completely invisible

items.name: Unseen Form
items.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Makes the caster semi-invisible. While on horseback, effect extends to cover the mount. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The Sellian assassins considered every option that aided their dirty work.
items.effects: Makes the caster semi-invisible

items.name: Thops's Barrier
items.description: The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone.
items.effects: Erect a magic forcefield to deflect spells

items.name: Zamor Ice Storm
items.description: Ice sorcery of the Town of Zamor.
items.effects: Thrust staff into ground to create freezing tornado.

items.name: Tibia's Summons
items.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death. Summons a group of Those Lost in Death. Three skeletons will appear some distance from the caster and attack foes before disappearing. The dead have long been left to wander; what they need is leadership.
items.effects: Summons Those Who Live in Death

items.name: Albinauric Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two Albinaurics.

items.name: Ancestral Follower Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of an ancestral follower.

items.name: Archer Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon three archer spirits.

items.name: Avionette Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two avionette soldiers. Spirits of marionette soldiers with avian features that were created to serve a sorcerer. Equipped with long-hafted scythes, they also attack from the skies by lobbing fire pots. Can sometimes malfunction when damaged.
items.effect: Summon the spirits of two avionette soldiers

items.name: Banished Knight Oleg
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Oleg, the Banished Knight.

items.name: Demi-human Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of five demi-humans.

items.name: Fanged Imp Ashes
items.description: Ashes remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon two fanged imp spirits.

items.name: Finger Maiden Therolina Puppet
items.description: One of Seluvis's puppets.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Finger Maiden Therolina

items.name: Giant Rat Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three giant rats.

items.name: Black Knife Tiche
items.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of Black Knife Tiche.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Black Knife Tiche

items.name: Glintstone Sorcerer Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a glintstone sorcerer.

items.name: Godrick Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two of Godrick's soldiers.

items.name: Jarwight Puppet
items.description: One of Seluvis' puppets. Use to summon the spirit of a jarwight.

items.name: Kaiden Sellsword Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell.Use to summon the spirit of a Kaiden sellsword.

items.name: Greatshield Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon five greatshield soldier spirits.

items.name: Lhutel The Headless
items.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of Lhutel the Headless.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Lhutel the Headless

items.name: Mad Pumpkin Head Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a mad pumpkin head. Spirit of a mad soldier with a large, brawny physique. Though he has stifled his panic within the dark confines of his helmet, he rampages as if driven mad when agitated by bloodshed or the humming of insects. This mad soldier is all that is left of a broken gladiator.
items.effect: Summon the spirit of a mad pumpkin head

items.name: Marionette Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two marionette soldiers.

items.name: Lone Wolf Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three lone wolves.

items.name: Mimic Tear Ashes
items.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of a mimic tear. Summoning consumes HP rather than FP.

items.name: Nightmaiden & Swordtress Puppets
items.description: An old puppet crafted in the Eternal City.

items.name: Noble Sorcerer Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a noble sorcerer. Spirit of a nobleman who once asked to be given a place at Raya Lucaria to learn glintstone sorceries. His talents were insufficient to be worthy of donning the stone crown, however, and he is only capable ofusing the most rudimentary sorcery.

items.name: Nomad Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a nomad.

items.name: Omenkiller Rollo
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Omenkiller Rollo.

items.name: Raya Lucaria Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three Raya Lucaria soldiers.
items.effect: Summons three Raya Lucaria soldier spirits

items.name: Page Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a page.

items.name: Skeletal Militiaman Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two skeletal militiamen.

items.name: Spirit Jellyfish Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon a spirit jellyfish.

items.name: Skeletal Bandit Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of a skeletal bandit.

items.name: Stormhawk Deenh
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Deenh the Stormhawk.

items.name: Twinsage Sorcerer Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a Twinsage sorcerer.

items.name: Wandering Noble Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of five wandering nobles.

items.name: Rotten Stray Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a rotten stray. Spirit of a stray dog corrupted by the scarlet rot.  Through it is only a small creature, it is as violent as it is nimble, and its fangs fester with poisonous rot

items.name: Warhawk Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a warhawk. Spirit of a Stormveil warhawk, the talons of which have been sliced off so that razor-fine swords could be grafted in their place. With its lord vanquished, and its wings wounded, the hawk perished as it solemnly gazed at its former home. The storm is a warhawk's cradle.

items.name: Latenna The Albinauric
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Latenna the Albinauric.
items.effect: Summons the spirit of Latenna the Albinauric

items.name: Winged Misbegotten Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a winged misbegotten.

items.name: Bloodhound Knight Floh
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Floh, the Bloodhound Knight.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Bloodhound Knight Floh

items.name: Perfumer Tricia
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Tricia, the perfumer.

items.name: Leyndell Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two Leyndell soldiers. Spirits of soldiers each equipped with a spear and greatshield. The soldiers of Leyndell fight their battles defensively. During the Shattering, they were the ramparts that fortified the royal capital.

items.name: Miranda Sprout Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of five miranda sprouts. Summoning consumes HP rather than FP. Spirits of sweet little miranda flowers, carnivorous blossoms that feed upon human flesh. They creep slowly, scattering toxic pollen. Vulnerable to fire—do take care of the little darlings

items.name: Vulgar Militia Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three vulgar militiamen. Spirits of the vulgar militia who wield long-hafted, serrated hatchets. These brutal weapons are particularly effective at causing blood loss to opponents. In the Lands Between, the small were scorned, and so they formed their vulgar militia as a means to make a living, albeit in ignominy.

items.name: Land Squirt Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three land squirts Summoning consumes HP rather than FP. These spirits appear some distance from the summoner. The firm, fleshy tubes of the creatures remain rooted to the spot, spraying poisonous liquid over their surroundings

items.name: Kindred Of Rot Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon a spirit of the Kindred of Rot. This spirit takes the form of a crawling pest, its chitinous body making a dry rustling sound. Attacks enemies by secreting sticky threads. The Kindred of Rot are the servants of the Goddess of Rot—servants that have been forsaken.

items.name: Ancient Dragon Knight Kristoff Ashes
items.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of Kristoff, the Ancient Dragon Knight. Spirit of Kristoff, an honorable knight of Leyndell who was also a devout worshipper of the ancient dragons. His skills strike down foes with thunderbolts, the dragons' weapon of choice. After the First Defense of Leyndell, Kristoff earned the hero's honor of Erdtree Burial for the feat of capturing Godefroy the Grafted.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Ancient Dragon Knight Kristoff

items.name: Azula Beastman Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two Azula beastmen. Spirits of beastmen from doomed Farum Azula, the slowly crumbling ruins in the skies. These ruins are said to be the remains of a giant mausoleum enshrining an ancient dragon, guarded by chosen beastmen who wield weapons clad in lightning.

items.name: Banished Knight Engvall Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Engvall, the Banished Knight. One of the two knights dubbed the Wings of the Storm. Despite his banishment, he rejected the invitation of the Grace-Given Lord, instead keeping watch over a masterless castle for many years, gaining renown as a hero of the fringes.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Banished Knight Engvall

items.name: Battlemage Hugues Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Battlemage Hugues. Hugues came from Sellia to study the Haima Conspectus at the academy, where he became a battlemage. Haima scholars seek to quell conflict with cannon fire and the gavel, but Hugues developed a longing for it.

items.name: Blackflame Monk Amon Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Amon, the Blackflame Monk. Amon swore fealty to the god-slaying black flame, and so became the first fire monk to turn traitor. Or perhaps it is better said that he fled from the Giants' Flame—out of cowardice.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Blackflame Monk Amon

items.name: Clayman Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two claymen. Bowed with age, these spirits are sluggish but hard to stagger. The warped remains of priests who searched for revelation in service of the ancient dynasty, they employ two sorceries that produce smaller and larger bubbles.

items.name: Crystalian Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a Crystalian. Spirit that wields round crystalline blades, both big and small. Its sturdy body, itself hewn from crystal long ago, is hard enough to blunt its opponent's blades, but blows from bludgeoning weapons can shatter it easily.

items.name: Depraved Perfumer Carmaan Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Carmaan, the depraved perfumer. Depraved perfumers practice their art for themselves alone. Carmaan was a notably formidable perfumer whose strength rivaled that of heroes, and it is said that he was in search of a secret physick of revivification.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Depraved Perfumer Carmaan

items.name: Cleanrot Knight Finlay Ashes
items.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of the Cleanrot Knight Finlay. Finlay was one of the few survivors of the Battle of Aeonia, who in an unimaginable act of heroism carried the slumbering demigod Malenia all the way back to the Haligtree. She managed the feat alone, fending off all manner of foes along the way.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Cleanrot Knight Finlay

items.name: Dung Eater Puppet
items.description: One of Seluvis's puppets. Use to summon the spirit of the Dung Eater. Spirit of a man who murdered thousands and defiled their corpses with the Seedbed Curse. Wields a spine greatsword and hurls curses. The Dung Eater despaired at how he met his end. How hideous and sinister this puppet is, and yet, its utter despair invites one to care for it.
items.effect: Summons spirit of the Dung Eater

items.name: Fire Monk Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a Fire Monk. Spirit of a stout monk who monitored the Giants' Flame. Versed in fire incantations, and himself steeled against fire. Though he was charged with keeping watch over the Flame, after many years of solemn duty, he has succumbed to its allure.

items.name: Dolores The Sleeping Arrow Puppet
items.description: One of Seluvis's favorite puppets. Use to summon the spirit of Dolores the Sleeping Arrow Spirit of a handsome archer who dressed in the style of a man. Called the Silent Hunter by some, she fires St. Trina's arrows from her shortbow. Dolores once belonged to the Roundtable Hold, where she was both a critic and a friend of Gideon the All-Knowing. It was because of her that he and Seluvis went their separate ways.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Solores the Sleeping Arrow

items.name: Haligtree Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of four Haligtree soldiers. Spirits of common soldiers who carry the sacred light. When weakened, they explode to deliver a last-ditch attack. This was the bitter revelation discovered by the desperate soldiers who awaited the return of their lord to the rotted Haligtree. May the flash of our deaths guide Miquella's return.

items.name: Man-serpent Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a man-serpent. Spirit of a deformed man-serpent that wields a whip of magma. It is said that long ago, the elder serpent that dwelled on Mt. Gelmir devoured a demigod, and the birth of the man-serpents followed.

items.name: Mausoleum Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of five mausoleum soldiers. Spirits of five headless soldiers who confound foes by disappearing and reappearing at will. The mausoleum is where the bodies of soulless demigods are lain to rest, and these soldiers followed their masters into Death by severing their own heads from their bodies.

items.name: Oracle Envoy Ashes
items.description: Ashen Remains in which spirits yet dwell.

items.name: Putrid Corpse Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of four putrid corpses.

items.name: Radahn Soldier Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two of Radahn's soldiers.

items.name: Redmane Knight Ogha
items.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of Ogha, the Redmane Knight. Spirit of a mighty knight versed in the use of a greatbow. A valiant warrior who will attack immediately after being summoned. The longest-serving member of the Redmane Knights, Ogha studied techniques to manipulate gravity alongside Radahn. May use a rain of gravitational arrows in response to a war cry, but only once.
items.effect: Summons spirit of Redmane Knight Ogha

items.name: Nepheli Loux Puppet
items.description: One of Seluvis's favorite puppets. Use to summon the spirit of Nepheli Loux. Puppet of a warrior who was betrayed by her pure heart. Wields a Stormhawk Axe in both hands and uses the Thunderstorm skill. A diamond in the rough, deserving of special care lest its potential be squandered. Nepheli Loux truly was a warrior.

items.name: Soldjars Of Fortune Ashes
items.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three little living jars. Summoning consumes HP rather than FP. These reckless spirits sacrifice themselves to vanquish their summoner's foes, and explode upon death. Though their bravery is admirable, their explosions can harm friend as well as foe, and they will also immediately explode on contact with fire. "Tell the others—tell them how brightly a fire jar burns."
items.effect: Summons three little living jar spirits

items.name: Arrow's Sting Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting three iron arrows. Carried by soldiers long ago.
items.effect: Raises attack power of arrows and bolts

items.name: Arsenal Charm
items.description: An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry. Boosts maximum equipment load. This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword, once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.

items.name: Assassin's Cerulean Dagger
items.description: An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in cerulean. Critical hits restore FP.

items.name: Assassin's Crimson Dagger
items.description: An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in crimson. Critical hits restore HP.

items.name: Arrow's Reach Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting three arrows. Carried by hunters of beasts.

items.name: Axe Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting an axe and a warrior. Enhances charge attacks.

items.name: Boltdrake Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a yellow ancient dragon. Boosts lightning damage negation.

items.name: Blue Dancer Charm
items.description: A cloth doll depicting a dancer garbed in blue. An ancient heirloom of some sort.
items.effect: Raises attack power with lower equipment load

items.name: Blessed Dew Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a drop of the Erdtree's sap, a blessed boon.

items.name: Bull-goat's Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting the horns of a bull-goat. Raises poise.

items.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion
items.description: A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Boosts maximum FP.

items.name: Carian Filigreed Crest
items.description: A talisman adorned with the royal crest.

items.name: Cerulean Seed Talisman
items.description: A cerulean-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed. Boosts FP restoration from the Flask of Cerulean Tears.
items.effect: Boosts FP restoration from Flask of Cerulean Tears

items.name: Clarifying Horn Charm
items.description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises focus. (Focus governs resistance to sleep and madness.)

items.name: Claw Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a claw and an assassin. Enhances jump attacks.

items.name: Crucible Knot Talisman
items.description: A talisman fashioned from a bony knot that embodies that aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.
items.effect: Reduces damage and impact of headshots

items.name: Crimson Amber Medallion
items.description: A medallion with Crimson amber inlaid. Boosts maximum HP. The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. A primordial life energy resides inside

items.name: Crucible Scale Talisman
items.description: A talisman fashioned from a scale that embodies the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.
items.effect: Reduces damage taken from critical hits

items.name: Crepus's Vial
items.description: Small mysterious bottle with a dark mist sealed within.
items.effect: Eliminates all sound made by the wearer during movement

items.name: Curved Sword Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a curved sword and a swordsman. Enhances guard counters.

items.name: Dragoncrest Shield Talisman
items.description: Wrought iron talisman depicting a trio of ancient dragons. Boosts physical damage negation.

items.name: Flamedrake Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a red ancient dragon. Boosts fire damage negation.

items.name: Fire Scorpion Charm
items.description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that burns with fire.
items.effect: Raises fire attack, but lowers damage negation

items.name: Godskin Swaddling Cloth
items.description: Sacred cloth of the Godskin Apostles, made from supple skin sewn together.

items.name: Faithful's Canvas Talisman
items.description: A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a group of masked figures. Raises potency of incantations.

items.name: Great-jar's Arsenal
items.description: A charm that resembles a great jar overflowing with weaponry. Vastly boosts maximum equipment load.

items.name: Haligdrake Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a golden ancient dragon. Boosts holy damage negation.

items.name: Green Turtle Talisman
items.description: A talisman in the shape of a green turtle. Raises stamina recovery speed.

items.name: Hammer Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a hammer and a knight. Enhances stamina-reducing attacks against a blocking opponent.

items.name: Immunizing Horn Charm
items.description: An accountrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises immunity. (Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)

items.name: Kindred Of Rot's Exultation
items.description: A talisman depicting the exultation of pests.
items.effect: Poisoning or rot in vicinity increases attack power

items.name: Lightning Scorpion Charm
items.description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that sparks with lightning.
items.effect: Raises lightning attack, but lowers damage negation

items.name: Longtail Cat Talisman
items.description: A brooch depicting Lacrima, the long-tailed cat.
items.effect: Renders the wearer immune to fall damage

items.name: Marika's Scarseal
items.description: An eye engraved with an Elden Rune. Said to be the seal of Queen Marika.
items.effect: Raises attributes, but also increases damage taken

items.name: Lord Of Blood's Exultation
items.description: A talisman depicting the exultation of the Lord of Blood.

items.name: Mottled Necklace
items.description: A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

items.name: Moon Of Nokstella
items.description: This legendary talisman is a treasure of Nokstella, the Eternal City.

items.name: Old Lord's Talisman
items.description: A legendary talisman depicting the ancient king whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time.

items.name: Pearldrake Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a pearlescent ancient dragon. Boosts non-physical damage negation.

items.name: Primal Glintstone Blade
items.description: An old glintstone blade that has been stained with blood.
items.effect: Spells consume less FP, but maximum HP is reduced

items.name: Prince Of Death's Pustule
items.description: A fetid pustule taken from facial flesh. Raises vitality. (Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)

items.name: Radagon Icon
items.description: A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Radagon. Shortens the casting time of sorceries and incantations.

items.name: Radagon's Scarseal
items.description: An eye engraved with an Elden Rune. Said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.
items.effect: Raises attributes, but also increases damage taken.

items.name: Radagon's Soreseal
items.description: This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.
items.effect: Greatly raises attributes, but also increases damage taken

items.name: Sacred Scorpion Charm
items.description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart with a blessed glow.
items.effect: Raises holy attack, but lowers damage negation.

items.name: Sacrificial Twig
items.description: A talisman fashioned from a dried twig, so slender that it might snap at the slightest touch.
items.effect: Will be lost on death in place of runes.

items.name: Shabriri's Woe
items.description: Disturbing likeness of a man whose eyes have been gouged out. The corners of his mouth are upturned in an almost flirtatious manner.

items.name: Spelldrake Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a blue ancient dragon. Boosts magic damage negation.

items.name: Stargazer Heirloom
items.description: A talisman engraved with the legend of a queen. Raises intelligence.

items.name: Twinblade Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a twinblade and a confessor. Enhances the final hit ending a chain of attacks.
items.effect: Enhances final hit of chain attacks.

items.name: Taker's Cameo
items.description: A talisman engraved with a stern likeness of Praetor Rykard, master of Volcano Manor.

items.name: Starscourge Heirloom
items.description: A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale. Raises strength.

items.name: Viridian Amber Medallion
items.description: A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Boosts maximum stamina. The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. A primordial life energy resides inside

items.name: Two Fingers Heirloom
items.description: A talisman engraved with the legend of the Two Fingers. Raises faith.

items.name: Winged Sword Insignia
items.description: A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade. An honor bestowed upon the knights who fought alongside Malenia the Severed.
items.effect: Raises attack power with successive attacks

items.name: Erdtree's Favor
items.description: A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree. Slightly raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.
items.effect: Raises maximum HP, stamina and equip load

items.name: Crimson Seed Talisman
items.description: A crimson-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed. Boosts HP restoration from the Flask of Crimson Tears.
items.effect: Boosts HP regeneration from Flask of Crimson Tears

items.name: Graven-school Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a school of graven mages, the nightmare of the academy.

items.name: Godfrey Icon
items.description: A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Godfrey. Raises charge attack power of sorceries, incantations, and skills.

items.name: Lance Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a lance and a knight. Enhances attacks while on horseback.

items.name: Graven-mass Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting the first school of graven mages — a nightmare that would continue to haunt the academy.  Greatly raises potency of sorceries.  The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.

items.name: Ancestral Spirit's Horn
items.description: Item cut from the horns of the Regal Ancestor Spirit.

items.name: Stalwart Horn Charm
items.description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Greatly raises robustness. (Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)  Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

items.name: Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman
items.description: Legendary talisman of wrought iron depicting a massive ancient dragon. Enormously boosts physical damage negation.

items.name: Marika's Soreseal
items.description: This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of Queen Marika.
items.effect: Greatly raises attributes, but also increases damage taken.

items.name: Gold Scarab
items.description: A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.

items.name: Ritual Sword Talisman
items.description: A talisman patterned after swords used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.
items.effect: Raises attack power when HP is at maximum.

items.name: Ritual Shield Talisman
items.description: A talisman patterned after shields used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.
items.effect: Raises defense when HP is at maximum.

items.name: Perfumer's Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a set of perfume bottles. Raises potency of perfume items.

items.name: Blue-feathered Branchsword
items.description: A talisman adorned with blue feathers, once used in ancient death rituals.
items.effect: Raises defense when HP is low.

items.name: Magic Scorpion Charm
items.description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that shimmers with magic.
items.effect: Raises magic attack, but lowers damage negation

items.name: Prince Of Death's Cyst
items.description: A fetid, overgrown cyst taken from facial flesh. Greatly raises vitality. (Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)

items.name: Warrior Jar Shard
items.description: Shard of a shattered warrior jar.
items.effect: Boosts the attack power of skills.

items.name: Shard Of Alexander
items.description: Shard of the late Alexander, a shattered warrior jar.
items.effect: Greatly boosts the attack power of skills.

items.name: Greatshield Talisman
items.description: Talisman depicting a knight holding a greatshield. Boosts guarding ability.

items.name: Millicent's Prosthesis
items.description: Part of the golden prosthesis used by Millicent. The hand is locked into a fist that once raised a sword aloft.
items.effect: Boosts dexterity, raises attack power with successive attacks

items.name: Spear Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a spear and a soldier. Enhances the counterattacks that are unique to thrusting weapons.
items.effect: Enhances counterattacks unique to thrusting weapons

items.name: Dagger Talisman
items.description: A talisman depicting a dagger and a surgeon. Enhances critical hits.

items.name: Red-feathered Branchsword
items.description: A talisman adorned with red feathers, once used in ancient death rituals.
items.effect: Raises attack power when HP is low.

items.name: Companion Jar
items.description: A talisman given by the jars to their friends. Raises potency of thrown jars.

items.name: Flock's Canvas Talisman
items.description: A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a mass of masked figures. Greatly raises potency of incantations.

items.name: Concealing Veil
items.description: Talisman put together from dark cloth with a lustrous sheen
items.effect: Conceals wearer while crouching away from foes

items.name: Furled Finger's Trick-mirror
items.description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure. Makes the bearer take on the appearance of a Host of Fingers One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.
items.effect: Take on appearance of a Host of Fingers

items.name: Crucible Feather Talisman
items.description: A talisman fashioned from feathers that embody the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.
items.effect: Improves dodge rolling but increases damage taken

items.name: Daedicar's Woe
items.description: Disturbing likeness of a woman whose skin was flayed. She smiles with a serene tenderness.

items.name: Host's Trick-mirror
items.description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.
items.effect: Take on appearance of a cooperator

items.name: Entwining Umbilical Cord
items.description: Mysterious circular object that's oddly warped. Changes the demeanour of the wearer's actions.

items.name: Hand Axe
items.description: Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool. Despite its short reach, it is easy to handle, exceling in successive attacks.

items.name: Jawbone Axe
items.description: Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal. This axe is more of a bludgeon; it forgoes a bladed edge, instead using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes, dealing strike damage.

items.name: Forked Hatchet
items.description: Peculiar hatchet wielded by imps. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.

items.name: Iron Cleaver
items.description: Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten.  Steeped in resentment, these weapons are swung wildly and relentlessly, often after rushing up to foes.

items.name: Battle Axe
items.description: A thick, heavy blade attached to a handle. A versatile, standard weapon Capable of powerful attacks thanks to the weighty blade, these weapons are also regarded for their powerful charge attacks.

items.name: Ripple Blade
items.description: Unique weapon wielded by young Albinaurics, this sword is modelled after the ripples that are thought to be the origin of their species. Its attack power is greatly enhanced with one's arcane attribute.

items.name: Icerind Hatchet
items.description: A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north. Known as "freezing fog," the blade is thought to be a dragon's scale. Inflicts a powerful frost effect.

items.name: Sacrificial Axe
items.description: Hatchet used in ancient sacrificial rite. A Deathbird is depicted as a malevolent deity. The power of the rite yet lingers. A small amount of FP is restored upon slaying a foe.

items.name: Celebrant's Cleaver
items.description: Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.

items.name: Rosus' Axe
items.description: Usher of Death, Rosus, who shows the path to the catacombs throughout the Lands Between, is depicted on this ritual axe. The dead easily lose their way, and have always been in sore need i of a guiding hand.

items.name: Highland Axe
items.description: Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands.  Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names. Roars are enhanced by this weapon.

items.name: Warped Axe
items.description: Oversized double-headed axe with a bizarre, almost melted appearance. Brute strength is the only thing required to wield this weapon, which appears to have taken quite the beating itself.

items.name: Stormhawk Axe
items.description: Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, wioth its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth. Their hearts are proud, and thereby easily undone.

items.name: Gargoyle's Black Axe
items.description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

items.name: Hand Ballista
items.description: An unconventional ballistic device modeled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.  Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle on facing an entire army alone.

items.name: Jar Cannon
items.description: Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.  Experimental firearm brought to the assault on Volcano Manor, where it was discovered that no one knew how to use it.

items.name: Longbow
items.description: Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage. To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.

items.name: Albinauric Bow
items.description: Longbow featuring delicate silverwork. Wielded by Albinauric wolfback archers. This bow requires dexterity over strength to master.

items.name: Erdtree Bow
items.description: Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow. Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

items.name: Horn Bow
items.description: Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.  Imbues arrows fired with magic damage. Reveals its true worth when used magic-infused arrows.

items.name: Serpent Bow
items.description: Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows. Used by assassins known as the Formless Serpents.

items.name: Pulley Bow
items.description: Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and strings.
